alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 7:57PM MST until June 29 at 10:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 755 PM MST, National Weather Service Flagstaff Doppler radar indicated light to moderate rainfall was still occurring across portions of the Crooks Burn area and Wolf Creek. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Groom Creek Subdivision, Lower Wolf Creek Campground and Upper Wolf Creek Group Campground. This includes the following swimming holes... Wolf Creek Falls. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Ash Creek, Middlewater Creek, Milk Creek, Turkey Creek, Wolf Creek, Board Creek, Hassayampa River and Lynx Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
